title: Dodging during champ select
body: I recently lost connection to my router while in champ select, when the connection came back I had dodged the game, and I get that there is no way for riot to distinguish between intentional disconnect and accidental ones. however what I want to know is: do I have a time frame to reconnect to champ select before I dodge, or does it happen the instant connection is lost to one of the users.

replies.body:
Technically once your connection to your router was lost, your connection to our servers would end, causing a *dodge* from everyone else's' perspective after you've timed out from the room (few seconds).

Let me know if you have any questions or need assistance with anything else.

cool, just wanted to know, because waiting for the internet to come back up on its own will usually take longer than just restarting the router straight up. I'll just do that from now on. thank you

I'd recommend troubleshooting that router or replacing it before it becomes a bigger problem for you. A trend of disconnections can land you in a *low-priority queue* and can become annoying when you have to wait out before entering queue.

I've tried a number of known-good routers, gone through my isp's tech support it never fixed the problem. At this point I'm relatively certain the problem lies with my isp and their servers. I live in the middle of nowhere and their pretty much the only isp available to me. The disconnects are pretty rare anyway no more than a couple times a week. 42ms pretty consistently, which I find to be good enough.

A traceroute log may reveal where the issues are happening in your network route and could prove useful in resolving this issue if provided to your ISP. I recommend running this log using a network app called [**WinMTR.**](http://winmtr.net/) After you've loaded up the app, you simply need to plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field and start the trace. After 5 minutes has gone by, export the trace results as text and paste them in a reply to me.

If you run into issues, please let me know.
